name: CP_7_1_Present_Guidelines_and_Protocols_for_Planning_Care
title: CP.7.1 Present Guidelines and Protocols for Planning Care (Function)
description: Present organizational guidelines for patient care as appropriate to support planning of care, including order entry and clinical documentation.
purpose: Guidelines, and protocols presented for planning care may be site specific, community or industry-wide standards.

statement.label: CP.7.1#01
statement.requirement: The system SHALL provide the ability to present current guidelines and protocols to providers who are creating plans for treatment and care.

statement.label: CP.7.1#02
statement.requirement: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render a guideline or protocol based on appropriate criteria (such as problem or medication).

statement.label: CP.7.1#03
statement.requirement: The system SHALL provide the ability to render previously used guidelines and protocols for historical or legal purposes.

statement.label: CP.7.1#04
statement.requirement: IF decision support prompts are used to support a specific clinical guideline or protocol, THEN the system SHALL conform to function [[CPS.3.8]] (Manage Documentation of Clinician Response to Decision Support Prompts).

statement.label: CP.7.1#05
statement.requirement: IF the system supports context sensitive care plans, guidelines and protocols, THEN the system SHALL conform to function [[CPS.3.4]] (Support for Context-Sensitive Care Plans, Guidelines, Protocols).
